page.title: 08BERWICK CHURCH INTERIOR
page.content: INTERIOR OF BUILDING. Stained glass windows very valuable. Those in west window have small Flemish medallions which were once in the chapel of the Duke of Buckingham . One side has plain glass as blast from bomb during 1939_45 shattered original windows.The chancel was added in 1855 Near the altar are four wooden statues of Matthew,Mark,Luke and John which look like marble. Above the altar is a coronna to represent the Crown of Thorns. The pews were made with wood from the castle. The font is as old as the church and beginning to crumble. A new cover is being made. The tester was replaced above the pulpit in 1973. It had been used as a table for many years.Organ built in 1725.Now valued at Â£50.000.Beautiful tablet showing flowers in memory of George Johnston,a famous naturalist.
